alert.note: Alert for Berks; Carbon; Lehigh; Monroe; Northampton (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 18 at 4:04AM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Berks, Lehigh, Carbon, Monroe and northwestern Northampton Counties through 500 AM EDT... At 400 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from the Poconos to northern Lancaster County. Movement was northeast around 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Reading, Lehighton, Mount Pocono, Wyomissing, Northampton, East Stroudsburg, Tobyhanna, Palmerton, Kutztown, Jim Thorpe, Hamburg, Slatington, Fleetwood, Sinking Spring, Laureldale, Nesquehoning, Womelsdorf, Weatherly, Wernersville and Walnutport. This includes the following highways... Northeast Extension between mile markers 59 and 97. Interstate 78 in Pennsylvania near mile marker 8, and between mile markers 10 and 52. Interstate 80 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 278 and 311. Interstate 380 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 0 and 13. Interstate 176 in Pennsylvania near mile marker 11. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
